title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 May 2014 - XWiki

09:00 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <kaisen> Good morning  
09:33 <kaisen> Today I successfully updated my 5.2.2 to 6.0 thanks for your help yesterday!  
09:34 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <kaisen> I just have now one problem, the search only gives results from the sandbox  
09:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <tmortagne> kaisen: is it SOLR search ? (does it looks like http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Solr+Search+Application)  
09:41 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
09:41 <tmortagne> AFAIK you have to delete the SOLR index when upgrading from 5.2.2 to 6.0 as the format changed  
09:42 <tmortagne> which mean stop XWiki, delete /var/lib/xwiki/data/solr/ folder and restart and SOLR with reindex everything  
09:44 <kaisen> Hello tmortagne, thanks for the fast answer, I just find a Mailinglist entrie which tells to delete the browser cache. Which also solve this problem for my desk.  
09:44 <kaisen> But I will delete also the SOLR Index as I cannot delete all browsercache from all users.  
09:45 <tmortagne> kaisen: it's not linked  
09:45 <tmortagne> cleanig the browser cache is for UI changed  
09:45 <tmortagne> I'm talking about actual indexed data  
09:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: seems we have a bug in comment rendering… check http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting?viewer=comments#xwikicomment\_4 the link doesn't point to the anchor (the source is: [[extensions:Extension.Localization Module||anchor="HRegisterawikitranslation"]]  
09:45 <vmassol> however if you check http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA it works  
09:45 <vmassol> am I too sleepy? :)  
09:46 <vmassol> actually it works in comment on http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA  
09:46 <tmortagne> I don't understand http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting?viewer=comments#xwikicomment\_4 does link to the last coment  
09:46 <vmassol> sure  
09:47 <vmassol> but in this comment there's a link  
09:47 <vmassol> to Localization Module  
09:47 <tmortagne> which morks  
09:47 <vmassol> really? you can see the anchor?  
09:47 <tmortagne> works  
09:47 <tmortagne> ha wait did not notice the anchor  
09:47 <tmortagne> no I don't have any anchor  
09:47 <vmassol> and on http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/VMA it works  
09:48 <vmassol> (same content)  
09:48 <tmortagne> I guess it's a xwiki/2.0 page  
09:48 <vmassol> ah yes maybe, I check only the page  
09:48 <vmassol> which was 2.1  
09:48 <vmassol> but I didn't check the sheet  
09:48 <vmassol> \*checked  
09:48 <tmortagne> I'm not talking about the sheet  
09:49 <tmortagne> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting is xwiki/2.0  
09:49 <vmassol> ah stupud me  
09:49 <tmortagne> so you can't put xwiki/2.1 link in one of its comments  
09:49 <vmassol> I checked the wrong page  
09:49 <vmassol> :)  
09:49 <vmassol> so indeed I'm not fully woken up yet :)  
09:50 <vmassol> thanks  
09:52 <kaisen> Should I also delete the lucene index?  
09:54 <tmortagne> kaisen: I doubt you are using it but it should not arm  
09:55 <tmortagne> Lucene is deprecated but we need to provide a REST access to SOLR before fully removing the Lucene module  
09:55 <kaisen> I thought it is used for the search suggestions  
09:55 <polx> has quit  
09:55 <kaisen> ok  
09:55 <tmortagne> SOLR is used for every search you see by default  
09:56 <tmortagne> you can move to Lucene if you want but our Lucene support is a lot less good now  
09:56 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <kaisen> Ok then the settings between the suggestions and the "normal" search is different as the normal one doesn't show attachement by default  
09:57 <tmortagne> yes it does not work exactly the same, the suggest is based on a set of high level filters (wikis, etc..) while the search page search in raw documents by default  
09:58 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Solr+Search+Application#HAdvancedSearchSuggestSources  
10:01 <kaisen> OK thanks! I really love the support here  
10:17 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <polx> has quit

10:24 <gdelhumeau> Concerning LESS, I am currently blocked by https://github.com/less/less.js/issues/2005 and https://github.com/marceloverdijk/lesscss-java/issues/49  
10:26 <cjd> watch as someone gets mad about codestyle re "for (var i=0; i<env.paths.length; ++i) {"  
10:26 <gdelhumeau> For the first one I have a PR, for the second, I may can do something too  
10:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki

13:47 <lucaa> has quit  
14:03 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
14:04 <vmassol> has quit  
14:11 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <cjd> we need a redirect splashpage which says "Why was I blocked?!" and explains that xwiki.org is not a playground  
14:23 <cjd> because this guy appears to be a non-spammer  
14:24 <tmortagne> probably  
14:24 <tmortagne> I'm not even sure what you see when you user is not active actually  
14:24 <tmortagne> probably a rights error message  
14:25 <tmortagne> cheking locally  
14:37 <tmortagne> making a use inactive does not seems to have much effect in 6.1-SNAPSHOT...  
14:37 <tmortagne> s/use/user/  
14:37 <cjd> haw  
14:38 <tmortagne> I can do whatever I want with my inactive user, no idea since when this is broken  
14:39 <tmortagne> at least in xwiki.org the guys stopped right when I made him inactive  
14:39 <cjd> yeah  
14:39 <cjd> I'm pretty sure it still works on xwikiorg  
14:40 <tmortagne> lets try with 5.4.3 then  
14:40 <cjd> was your test user admin in your test?  
14:40 <tmortagne> no  
14:40 <tmortagne> just created a user with default rights  
14:40 <cjd> hmm  
14:40 <tmortagne> then logged out and logged in with this user  
14:41 <tmortagne> checking something  
14:41 <tmortagne> yep I definitely can do anything I want  
14:41 <tmortagne> except admin stuff of course since i'm not admin  
14:42 <tmortagne> I can even edit my profile and see that I'm inactive :)  
14:42 <cjd> heh  
14:42 <tmortagne> now this user is the creator of this profile as usual but anyway I can edit any other page  
14:43 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
14:43 <tmortagne> downloading 5.4.3  
14:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <tmortagne> I can't male inactive work in 5.4.3 either  
14:47 <tmortagne> s/male/make/  
14:48 <tmortagne> \* creating a user with Admin user  
14:48 <tmortagne> \* making it inactive  
14:48 <tmortagne> \* I can edit the Main.WebHome page  
14:48 <tmortagne> lets try on xwiki.org  
14:50 <tmortagne> cjd: could you make that user inactive  
14:50 <cjd> sure  
14:50 <cjd> I really need a script for this :)  
14:50 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <tmortagne> so he just decided to stop it seems...  
14:51 <cjd> wow  
14:51 <tmortagne> inactive has no effect  
14:51 <cjd> I say wow because I did this once before and it was similarly effective  
14:52 <tmortagne> probably a recent regression  
14:52 <tmortagne> I have to move, BB in 1h and I will check in older versions  
14:52 <cjd> no, last time I did it was just a couple weeks ago  
14:52 <tmortagne> hmm  
14:52 <cjd> the air-fist-shaking-effect  
14:53 <cjd> you get mad at someone and they suddenly get nervous and stop  
14:53 <cjd> :)  
14:53 <tmortagne> anyway lets move, will debug that later (not even sure how it's supposed to work in detail actually)  
14:54 <cjd> see ya  
14:58 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
15:18 <msmeria> has quit  
16:03 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
16:50 <xwikinewb> I would like to generate texts (configurations actually) from a web form. Is Xwiki scripting a good match for this problem?  
16:51 <kaisen> has quit  
16:51 <xwikinewb> Or can I squeeze in a JS app there somehow?  
16:53 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I propose to rollback your change re prototype  
16:53 <vmassol> XE has been broken for too long already  
16:53 <vmassol> wdyt?  
16:53 <vmassol> xwikinewb: sure you can do everything with xwik it's a dev platform ;)  
16:55 <vmassol> xwikinewb: if you need to add js into a wiki page you should check this:  
16:55 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial  
16:55 <xwikinewb> Will do, thanks.  
16:56 <vmassol> but you don't need js to perform computation  
16:56 <vmassol> you can use any of the supported scripting languages:  
16:56 <vmassol> velocity, groovy, ruby, python, etc  
16:59 <xwikinewb> I will not do much computation for this application, but anything not JS is nice :) But I need some time to learn how to access forms and bind to action-buttons.  
16:59 <vmassol> yep there are some tutorials  
16:59 <vmassol> what you want is checkout the dev guides: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WebHome  
17:00 <vmassol> we're missing a proper tutorial on forms though I think  
17:00 <xwikinewb> Ok. Got three pages (with links) to read already now.  
17:00 <vmassol> however there are plenty of examples in your wiki  
17:01 <xwikinewb> I'll take notes. Then I can write one.  
17:28 <cjd> has quit  
17:28 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
17:51 <sdumitriu> vmassol: OK for the rollback, I'll debug it locally and commit once it works  
17:51 <sdumitriu> Doing the rollback now  
17:52 <sdumitriu> Done  
17:53 <vmassol> sdumitriu: thanks  
17:53 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:00 <tmortagne> vmassol: latest 6.0.1-SNAPSHOT log a "17:43:42.469 [Thread-1] INFO  o.x.t.i.XWikiLogOutputStream - 2014-05-14 17:43:42,469 [Active Installs Ping Thread] WARN  a.i.c.ActiveInstallsPingThread - Failed to send Active Installation ping to [http://extensions.xwiki.org/activeinstalls]. Error = [SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out]. Will retry in [86400] seconds... "  
18:00 <tmortagne> (http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards-6.0.x/8/consoleFull)  
18:00 <tmortagne> xwiki.org seems ok  
18:00 <tmortagne> maybe it's an issue with build agent  
18:00 <tmortagne> should we disabled it during integration tests ?  
18:01 <vmassol> tmortagne: hmm the fact that it's a socket timeout shows that it's a problem accessing xwiki.org I think  
18:01 <tmortagne> (like we disabled EM repositories for example)  
18:01 <vmassol> yes we should  
18:01 <evalica1> has quit  
18:01 <vmassol> we can do that by setting the xwiki.properties property I think  
18:01 <tmortagne> that would mean the agent cannot access xwiki.org then since xwiki.org is ok  
18:01 <vmassol> it could have been at a time when it was down  
18:01 <vmassol> no?  
18:02 <tmortagne> it was 10 minutes ago  
18:03 <vmassol> btw just chekced my code and I don't skip the ping send even when the property is ""  
18:03 <vmassol> would need to add an "if"  
18:03 <vmassol> (referring to activeinstalls.pingURL)  
18:04 <vmassol> then we could set that property for our functional tests  
18:04 <vmassol> (set it to "" I mean)  
18:04 <vmassol> I can do that later, just need to remember it :)

18:14 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:43 <vmassol> sdumitriu: what's the domain name that you had setup for converting content from one syntax to another using the rendering engine already?
